Package hu.bme.mit.theta.solver

Interface UCSolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, SolverBase
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SmtLibSolver, Yices2SmtLibSolver
    public interface UCSolver
extends SolverBase
    Common interface for SMT solvers with unsat core capabilities. Use the track(Expr) method to add expressions to the solver. Then use SolverBase.check() method to check their satisfiability. The result can be queried by SolverBase.getStatus(). If the expressions are satisfiable, a satisfying assignment can be obtained by SolverBase.getModel(). If the expressions are not satisfiable, use getUnsatCore() to obtain the unsat core. The solver can also support incremental solving by SolverBase.push() and SolverBase.pop().

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • track

        void track​(Expr<BoolType> assertion)
        Add and track an expression. Required to calculate unsat cores.
        Parameters:
        assertion - Expression to be tracked

      • track

        default void track​(java.lang.Iterable<? extends Expr<BoolType>> assertions)

        Parameters:
        assertions - Expressions to be tracked

      • getUnsatCore

        java.util.Collection<Expr<BoolType>> getUnsatCore()
        Get an unsat core, i.e., a (not necessarily) minimal subset of the expressions that are already unsatisfiable. It only works if expressions were added by track(Expr) or track(Iterable). Furthermore, it should only be called if SolverBase.check() was already called and the result is UNSAT.
        Returns:
        Unsat core
